gameobjects

Interface Shooter

  • All Superinterfaces:
    GameObject
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    PlayerShip, ShooterEnemyShip

    public interface Shooter
extends GameObject
    This interface defines the shooting functions. The shooter will be a GameObject. The functions are shoot() and timeToShoot(), so it implies some kind of cool down.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void shoot()
      This method is responisble for firing bullets.
      boolean timeToShoot()
      This method checks if it's time for the shooter to shoot or if it's still cooling down.

      • Methods inherited from interface gameobjects.GameObject

        draw, getCenter, getDirection, getHealthPoints, getHeight, getImage, getPosition, getWidth, getXCenter, getXDirection, getXPosition, getXVelocity, getYCenter, getYDirection, getYPosition, getYVelocity, gotHit, initializeLocation, isDead, makeDead, move, moveDirection, movePosition, setDirection, setDirectionToward, setHealthPoints, setImage, setImageLocation, setPosition, setXDirection, setXPosition, setXVelocity, setYDirection, setYPosition, setYVelocity

    • Method Detail

      • shoot

        void shoot()
        This method is responisble for firing bullets. When it's called, it check if it's time for the shooter to shoot. If so, it fires.

      • timeToShoot

        boolean timeToShoot()
        This method checks if it's time for the shooter to shoot or if it's still cooling down.
        Returns:
        returns true if it's time to shoot. False otherwise
